questionText: In 2000, for the first time the American Academy of Pediatrics set specific guidelines for diagnosis of ADHD.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: ADHD, a chemical disorder in the brain, can cause impulsivity, inability to concentrate, and difficulty learning.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: ADHD, attention-deficit-hyperactivity disorder, is a neurological and genetic disorder.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: The American Psychiatric Association first described it in 1980.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Outward symptoms generally include impulsiveness, inability to concentrate, difficulty in learning, and restlessness.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: It is estimated that from three to five or even nine percent of children have the disorder.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Symptoms of ADHD include impulsiveness, inability to concentrate, difficulty in learning and restlessness.
author: A2CCK1JKX48R0H

questionText: Ritalin has side effects including sleeplessness and loss of appetite.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: The use of medicine is more effective than behavior modification therapy.
author: A49WTQG4MBT9Z

questionText: Adderall, a mixture of two kinds of amphetamines, is effective for treating ADHD.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y
